Legal_Issue: Whether the Citizenship Judge erred in applying the residency requirement under s. 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act and provided insufficient reasons
Application_Facts: Applicant was absent from Canada for 330 days, falling short by 37 days of the 1,095-day physical presence requirement within four years prior to application
Decision_Outcome: Citizenship application initially rejected by Citizenship Judge
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Citizenship Judge's decision
Court_Ruling: Appeal allowed; case remanded for reconsideration by another Citizenship Judge
Defendant_Behavior: Citizenship Judge did not clarify which test (physical presence or quality of attachment) was applied
Grounds_for_Claim: Insufficient reasoning and failure to identify legal test used in assessing residency
Legal_Standard: Physical presence test (strict) vs. quality of attachment test (flexible) under s. 5(1)(c)
Assessment_Factor: Duration and pattern of absences from Canada
Procedural_Issue: Lack of clarity in judicial reasoning and failure to articulate applicable legal test
Evidence_Used: Documentation of applicant's travel and residency history
Application_Basis: Requirement to prove 1,095 days of physical presence in Canada
Evidence_Assessed: Travel records and supporting documents submitted by applicant
Relief_Sought: Allowance of citizenship application or remittal for proper assessment
Governing_Rule: Applicant must demonstrate compliance with residency requirement through clear evidence and correct legal framework
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Judge requested additional documentation but did not explain how it would affect the outcome or which test was used
Outcome: Case remanded for reconsideration due to inadequate reasons
Harm_Assessment: Potential denial of citizenship rights due to procedural unfairness
Cause_Description: Dispute over residency requirements for citizenship application due to absences and unclear judicial reasoning
Evidence_Handling: Incomplete evaluation of residency evidence due to lack of articulated legal framework
Legal_Provision_Violated: s. 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act â€“ Residency requirement
Evidence_Issues: Insufficient explanation of how evidence was weighed in decision
Residency_Compliance: Not met according to strict physical presence calculation
Evidence_Assessment: Judge failed to adequately assess or explain evaluation of residency evidence
Decision_Rationale: Error in law due to failure to specify test applied and provide sufficient reasons
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of clarity on evidentiary standard and treatment of submitted documents
